byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood reported from Nashua, and Katharine Q. Seelye from Boston.
byline.original: By JESS BIDGOOD and KATHARINE Q. SEELYE

abstract: Schools in Nashua, NH, are set to reopen after terrorist threat; details of threat have been withheld, and police have not said whether it was connected to any other threats across United States.
lead_paragraph: The police chief said investigators had determined that there was no “current, credible” threat related to an email sent to the schools’ superintendent on Sunday.

headline.main: Schools in Nashua, N.H., to Reopen After Threat
headline.print_headline: Schools in New Hampshire Will Reopen After Threat

snippet: The police chief said investigators had determined that there was no “current, credible” threat related to an email sent to the schools’ superintendent on Sunday.
